system.description:
Chief. The hungriest ghosts, dead spirits, burning shadows. They live in the mountains. Do not stay out in the mountains for too long. They will tear your skin. They run faster than wind.

(The stats provided here is for a Rank 1 encounter with 4 Kadungganan. Check the book for higher ranks.)

traits.name: Poise
traits.description: Whenever a Chief suffers a Status Effect or is forcibly moved, they can choose to ignore it and gain a Poise Token instead. When they gain 5 Poise Tokens, they become Poise Broken: they can suffer all Status Effects, can be forcibly moved as normal, and cannot gain any more Poise Tokens. While Poise Broken, a Chief loses 1 Poise Token whenever they start their riff. When they lose all Poise Tokens, they lose Poise Broken and can again gain Poise Tokens.

traits.name: Dragon Eye
traits.description: Chiefs can riff a number of times per Resound equal to the Kadungganan.

traits.name: Walking Dead
traits.description: When Dead fall to 0 HP, they become a pile of grudge. However, they still Riff: at the start of their Riff, they have a 33% chance of reforming and heal 2 HP, and they can riff again. Piles of grudges can be exorcised by spending 1 Beat while close to them. Once Exorcised, they are removed from play. Any Dead that falls to 0 HP by fire or burning holy radiance are immediately exorcised.

traits.name: Earthen Body
traits.description: All Dead are immune to poison, bleed, and chill.

traits.name: Shadow Person
traits.description: The unglu cannot be a valid target for any effect unless the origin square is adjacent to the unglu.

traits.name: Faster Than Wind
traits.description: The unglu teleports when it rushes. It inflicts 1 Hit on every fighter adjacent to it after teleporting.

traits.name: Horror
traits.description: The unglu is one of the most feared creatures in Gubat Banwa. The unglu can inflict the Horrified: Those Horrified cannot end their Fulmination closer to the Unglu, and they suffer -1d to all Defense Teeth. They clear horrified at the end of their riff.

system.attacks:
Inflict Violence: Shadow Blades. Attack all enemies in an area (blast 3) with Faith, then horrify the targets.

Gambits [[/r d6]]

Phase 1: The Shadow Between The Trees. It flits between shadows.

1-3: Rush > Inflict Violence > Inflict Violence

4-6: Rush > Inflict Violence > Unknown Being [1]: An unglu clone appears in range 6, then confuse all enemies adjacent to both unglu. The unglu can use their clone as the origin point for all effects. At the end of the Resound, the unglu chooses one of the clones, and that becomes the unglu, the other clone dissipates.

Phase 2: The Thing That Flenses Skin. It crawls out into the light.

1-2: Rush > Inflict Violence > Inflict Violence

3-4: Rush > Inflict Violence > Unknown Being [1]: An unglu clone appears in range 6, then confuse all enemies adjacent to both unglu. The unglu can use their clone as the origin point for all effects. At the end of the Resound, the unglu chooses one of the clones, and that becomes the unglu, the other clone dissipates.

5: Shadow Flame [1]: Teleport 10 tiles. Set all tiles adjacent to the first tile and the tile the unglu ends in aflame. > Inflict Violence > Devour Horror [1]: Inflict 1 True Hit on all horrified enemies, clear horrified, and then heal 2.

6: Nothing Is Scarier [4]: At the end of the current Resound, the Unglu disappears deeper into the woods, or away from the Battlefield. The Kadungganan suffer Defeat. If this Unglu is encountered again, they will have the same amount of HP remaining. If this is rolled before Resound 3, reroll it until it no longer rolls 6. Perform this automatically during the Unglu's first riff of Resound 6.
